info.title: Tournament Platform API
info.description: API documentation for the Tournament Platform project. This documentation is auto-generated.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Authentication related endpoints (login, register, refresh, logout, email verification)

tags.name: User Game Profiles
tags.description: Management of user profiles for specific games

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Webhook endpoints for external services (e.g., payment gateways)

description.example: Optional array of specific error messages
List of roles assigned to the user.
Indicates if the user's email is verified
The verification token received by email.
User ID of the verified user
Array of roles to assign to the user.
User's in-game name for this game.
Any other game-specific details (e.g., region, platform).
ID of the user game profile record.
Short tag for the team (alphanumeric, uppercase suggested)
Role of the member in the team
ID of the user who owns the team
ID of the user to add as a member.
Role to assign to the new member.
Rank of the user/entity in the leaderboard.
Unique identifier of the user (could be UUID or other string format depending on actual User ID type).
The value of the metric for this entry (e.g., score, wins count, earnings amount).
Number of games played (example additional stat).
Name of the game for this leaderboard.
Total number of entries in this leaderboard for the given filters.
Game name for the leaderboard context.
List of leaderboard entries surrounding the user (e.g., +/- 2 ranks).
Name of the participant (username or team name)
In-game name if applicable (e.g., for a UserGameProfile related to the match's game)
ID of the tournament this match belongs to
ID of the game being played
Actual start time of the match
Actual end time of the match
ID of the next match for the winner
Image filename (e.g., result.jpg). Must be png, jpg, jpeg, or gif. No slashes.
The pre-signed URL to upload the file to.
The S3 object key where the file will be stored. This key should be sent when submitting the match result.
ID of the user or team that won.
S3 file key of the uploaded screenshot (obtained from /upload-url endpoint).
Optional comments about the match result.
ID of the match for which the result was submitted.
ID of the game for this tournament.
Total prize pool for the tournament.
Start date and time of the tournament in ISO 8601 format. Must be in the future.
End date and time of the tournament in ISO 8601 format. Must be after startDate.
ID of the user organizing the tournament (if not the admin creating it).
Name of the game (can be part of an embedded game object too)
ID of the tournament participant record (if applicable).
Status of the registration (e.g., CONFIRMED, PENDING_PAYMENT).
User ID associated with the wallet.
Balance that is pending (e.g., from deposits not yet cleared or withdrawals being processed).
Amount to deposit (must be positive, max 2 decimal places).
URL to redirect the user to for completing the payment.
Unique ID for this deposit transaction.
Status of the transaction if idempotency key caused a replay (e.g., PENDING, COMPLETED).
Transaction amount. Positive for credits, negative for debits.
Date and time of the transaction.
ID of a related entity (e.g., tournamentId, matchId).
Type of the related entity (e.g., TOURNAMENT, MATCH).
ID from the payment gateway, if applicable.
PayPal email address (required if type is PAYPAL).
Bank account holder name (required if type is BANK_TRANSFER).
Bank account number (required if type is BANK_TRANSFER).
Bank routing number (required if type is BANK_TRANSFER).
Name of the bank (optional for BANK_TRANSFER).
ID of the withdrawal transaction created.
Current status of the withdrawal request.
ID of the admin/moderator who handled it.
The final status to resolve the dispute.
ID of the user who requested withdrawal.
Notes added by admin during approval/rejection.
Optional notes by the admin approving the request.
Reason for rejecting the withdrawal request.
